alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 9:07PM CDT until May 12 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri...Iowa...Illinois... Mississippi River at Keokuk LD19 affecting Lee, Hancock and Clark Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois...Missouri... Mississippi River at New Boston LD17 affecting Mercer and Louisa Counties. Mississippi River at Muscatine affecting Mercer, Muscatine, Louisa and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Ill. City LD16 affecting Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Rock Island LD15 affecting Scott, Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Fulton LD13 affecting Carroll, Whiteside and Clinton Counties. Mississippi River at Camanche affecting Scott, Rock Island, Whiteside and Clinton Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11 affecting Dubuque and Jo Daviess Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque affecting Dubuque, Jackson and Jo Daviess Counties. Mississippi River at Gregory Landing affecting Hancock and Clark Counties. Mississippi River at Keithsburg affecting Mercer, Des Moines, Louisa and Henderson Counties. Mississippi River at Le Claire LD14 affecting Scott and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Burlington affecting Des Moines, Lee, Hancock and Henderson Counties. Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18 affecting Des Moines and Henderson Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Keokuk LD19. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Water affects low lying buildings in rural areas. Water affects the railroad tracks in Alexandria. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:10 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 12.3 feet next Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Friday morning.
